title: Nash Equilibrium for North Springs, South Springs

content.description: North Springs and South Springs are two firms that serve the local market for bottled water. Each firm must choose to either maintain or increase its current output. The first entry in each cell in the payoff matrix below shows the profits for North Springs, and the second entry in each cell shows the profits for South Springs.
content.question: If the two firms do not cooperate, which of the following represents the payoff North Springs and South Springs receive in the dominant-strategy equilibrium and the Nash equilibrium?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
